It mushrooms in our peripheral vision and drifts towards us as we batter out advent calendar posts, hoping we can finish writing and beat a tactical withdrawal to the kitchen before the accusatory phantom overwhelms us. It’s a game about sin and projectile patterns and llamas. It’s...
Read more
articles.title: The RPS Advent Calendar 2024, December 10th

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I’ve got a strange relationship with the stealth sandbox murderbox that is Hitman: World of Assassination. If you were to ask me to list my favourite games, the latest Hitman trilogy would be in the top five, no question. And yet, I must have gotten intimidated at some point with the amount of new updates and all the spiffy unlockable suits I was missing out on, and just haven’t touched it in a couple of years now. Is the appearance of Jean-Claude Van Damme as the game’s newest elusive target enough to reel me back in? I'm not sure, but I will say that I doubt Sean Bean can stretch his legs like that, even with the legendary flexibility offered by O2's famously variable plans. Here’s a trailer.
Read more
articles.title: Jean-Claude Van Damme is coming to Hitman this week as a double-crossing ICA agent, and it’s free to play for a month

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
If we follow Marshall McLuhan’s ideas about technology being an extension of the body, then the copy and paste keyboard shortcuts are my equivalent of a trip to one of Cyberpunk 2077’s ripperdocs. In the writing of this single article, I will use them for links, HTML code, and other ephemera. I even copied McLuhan’s name across from a different tab, which I’m sure he’d appreciate/be horrified by. I love those shortcuts. I need them. They are the wind beneath my wings, and the crud buildup beneath the bottom left of my keyboard.
I cannot say how the first tailor to gaze upon a sewing machine felt, nor the first egg-abacus attendant to behold the sorcerous ticking of the automated egg timer. But I think now that when they saw those things, they were afraid. As I am afraid now.
Read more
articles.title: This is my first time learning of this nearly useless novelty keyboard gift and I am in mourning for all the microseconds I’ve wasted in my life

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I’m quite smitten by the Nintendo DS stylings and traditional roguelike charms of Shiren the Wanderer: The Mystery Dungeon Of Serpentcoil Island, but I’m having real trouble summoning up the motivation to repeatedly grind through its opening levels to get to the interesting stuff. Early stages soon lose any real sense of surprise, and later ones can feel low on real agency. I want a new roguelike run to feel vital and verdant; heady with grand plans and plan-shattering twists. But by having randomness influence each run so significantly, Mystery Dungeon feels fickle instead of emergent - less than the sum of some incredibly novel and creative parts.
Read more
articles.title: Shiren the Wanderer: The Mystery Dungeon Of Serpentcoil Island Review: a traditional roguelite heavy on charm but light on agency

articles.author: Robert Anderson
articles.description:
Indiana Jones and the Great Circle isn’t just good. It’s excellent. If you’re excited about playing the game on launch day (or beyond) and want to get the best deal possible, then look no further.
 Read more
articles.title: You can score Indiana Jones and the Great Circle for PC at a discount on launch day, here's how

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Fancy taking the piss out of video games? Here you go, a fun little tool you can run in your browser easily lets you rewrite famous game quotes. The Death Generator offers a gallery full of (mostly) retro games and a simple text box that will replicate the exact font used by those games, all so you can make the little shopkeeper in Zelda say rude words, or entirely rewrite the pre-mission dossiers of Goldeneye 007. There's a lot more than that though. I've done a bunch, come see what I mean and have a go yourself.
Read more
articles.title: "Winners do drugs after all" - you can rewrite your favourite game screens with this fun tool

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The big question a Tekken player always wants to know is: which DLC character is coming next? Well, you'll know by the end of the week, as the studio is planning to reveal this at Geoff Keighley's winter festival of expensive advertising, the Game Awards. However, there may already be some clues in a trailer they've just released, which suggests some sisterful slapping is overdue. The trailer also promises new moves for all characters in a Season 2 update next spring, along with some minor presents in a winter update due sooner than that. But yes, come see for yourself.

 
Read more
articles.title: Tekken 8's next character will be revealed this week, and clues point to a certain lady in red

articles.author: RPS
articles.description:
There’s an awful lot behind this door, lemme tell ya. Hours of adventure, of tension, of action, of sci-fi strangeness. It’ll be great. Unfortunately the door itself is bugged out so you’ll need to reload a quicksave or something to get it open.

 
Read more
articles.title: The RPS Advent Calendar 2024, December 9th

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
It's not just because he's a Nazi. It's because he's a smartass Nazi. As the main antagonist in Indiana Jones And The Great Circle, Emmerich Voss vacates the archetypal armchair usually reserved for secondary fascist goons, so that he can goosestep straight into the big boy seat himself. He smiles with all the sleaze of right-hand-man Major Toht, the grubby gestapo who gets that right hand burned in Raiders of the Lost Ark. Yet he also engages in the pseudo-intellectual trash talk of the main archaeological rivals to Jones, like Rene Belloq or Walter Donovan. He is a hideous grab bag of all the things that make an instantly detestable villain in the series. But there's something else. Voss is so immediately and gutturally hateable because he resembles a type of racist encountered not in the 1930s, but one you've probably met today: the asshole you meet on the internet.
Warning: Here be spoilers.
Read more
articles.title: I have rarely hated a bad guy as much as I hate Voss in Indiana Jones And The Great Circle

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
The only sound that greets you upon booting up Eclipsium is a loudly throbbing heart. As one must when encountering horror media, the game and I immediately enter a spiritual staring contest, each of us knowing the real game here was it trying to freak me out. "It’s fine", I decided. "It’s just a heart! I’ve got a heart. It’s actually very useful. Nothing to be scared of". Thing is, Eclipsium’s menu heart is actually massive and sits, like The Eye Of Sauron, atop a giant obelisk. “Ah. That’s definitely a horror thing, that” I was forced to admit. "If my heart was on a giant obelisk, I’d be proper shaken up, I reckon."
So starts Eclipsium’s very first bit of aggressive disorientation, and it basically just escalates from there. I obviously can’t describe the vibes without slightly spoiling the vibes, so do pop over to Steam for a demo if you’re curious and, oh, there’s a potted plant, the sound of its rustling mixed in such a way that it sort of sounds like it’s shrieking at me. Well.
Read more
articles.title: It’s worth downloading the demo for uncanny horror Eclipsium just to stare at your hands

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
“Hang on a sec. Haven’t I seen this exact genre of little guy before?” was my reaction upon encountering the yellow-eyed, hat-shrouded mage of isometric adventure Oolo. Some quick internet sleuthing turned up this lovely bit of art featuring Final Fantasy 9’s Vivi, Journey’s Traveller, and He-Man’s Orko. It’s a great feeling to begin your week identifying an archetype of diminutive magician, and I hope it becomes a regular occurrence. Another pleasant  discovery was Oolo itself, which you can discover yourself through the shrouded magic of this link to it’s free demo.
(Do I need to keep writing ‘free demo’, by the way? I tend to alternate. It’s obviously redundant but I feel writing ‘free’ gives it a certain gravitas. Free tax rebate. Free sunrise. Free oxygen. It makes things sound better.)
Read more
articles.title: The demo for Oolo offers up a magical metroidvania with hints of classic Zelda

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Happy this week all! It's almost time to give 2024 the finger, swallow a flagon of mince pie formula and tapdance backwards into the holiday, but the Maw still needs a little feeding and it has no appetite for mince pies. Nor will it eat tinsel, candy canes, mistletoe, snowmen or reindeer, though goodness knows we've tried. So much screaming. No, the Maw's penchant remains for new PC game releases, and thankfully, they are as thick on the ground as reindeer pelts.
  
Read more
articles.title: The Maw: what's new in PC games this week?

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! Everyone knows about ‘hardback’ and ‘softback’ books, but have you heard of the quickly discontinued ‘rice puddingback’? While hiring so many rice grain artists to transpose the blurbs in beautiful calligraphy made for an impressive spectacle, they were eventually banned after several fatal train slippage and/or smellage incidents. Ah well!  This week, it’s Charlene Putney, who’s been writing for games for over ten years, including bits for Divinity: Original Sin 2, Baldur's Gate 3, NUTS, and Saltsea Chronicles! Cheers Charlene! Mind if we have a nose at your bookshelf?
Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: Divinity: Original Sin 2, Baldur's Gate 3, and Saltsea Chronicles’ Charlene Putney

articles.author: RPS
articles.description:
Today's door is shimmering and promises dark magics within. It's an unlikely marriage of big budget publisher and a genre beloved most by smaller development teams. What mastery will unlock the door and expose the vast arenas within? Why, clicking to read more, of course.

 
Read more
articles.title: The RPS Advent Calendar 2024, December 8th

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Sundays are for, I hope, upgrading my PC swiftly and successfully and then getting down to business. Think of all the games I can now play! But I'll probably just play Dune Imperium.

Gail Mackenzie-Smith in Electric Lit wrote a Dear John letter breaking up with Wordle.

 
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
There's no perfect time to release a video game, but if I were deciding when to release one, do you know when I'd do it? Alongside the largest blockbusters of the year, at a time when everyone is broke from buying presents, and on the same day as a huge awards show is distracting the industry's media. 

Ballionaire apparently shares my thinking. The pachinko-inspired roguelike is launching on December 10th.

 
Read more
articles.title: Ballionaire, the physics roguelike in which you build pachinko boards, drops on December 10th

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I had a few merry evenings playing Escape Simulator back in 2022. Of the co-op escape room games I've played, it was the best, both in terms of its relatively neutral framing (with little heavyhanded storytelling) and its pretty solid puzzle design. The game was expanded in the time since with a versus mode and several crossover DLC, and now there comes a sequel.

Escape Simulator 2 will explore "darker escape room themes", looks visually more detailed, and comes with a new editor for those who wish to design their own escape rooms.

 
Read more
articles.title: Escape Simulator 2 announced with promises of Dracula's castle and an improved escape room editor

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
This happened on Thursday, but we were busy with other, less interesting news. Late or not, I can't let it pass unremarked upon: Caves Of Qud, the vast, weird roguelike which has been in development for 17 years, hit version 1.0. It brings multiple endings to the game, a revised UI, improved tutorials and much more.

 
Read more
articles.title: Caves Of Qud, one of the most exciting development projects in PC gaming, hit 1.0 this week

articles.author: RPS
articles.description:
You could open today's door, sure. You could also blow it up with an explosive, though. Or shoulder-barge your way through the wall beside it. Or plant some C4 on the ceiling and go up and over. Or I think that's a load-bearing pillar over there - may as well just bring down the entire advent calendar to find out what's behind today's door.

 
Read more
articles.title: The RPS Advent Calendar 2024, December 7th

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
Morning, all. Hope you're keeping those game-playing hands nice and toasty this winter. You can do it however you like. Wear gloves, huff on them, sit on them, give a fluffy cat a good squeeze. I personally like to clasp a mug of almost-too-hot coffee while I gaze at my Steam library wondering where the hours have gone. To each their own. Here's what we're all clicking on this weekend!
 Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
The protagonists of two of my all time favourite RPGs share something in common. Both (the best Final Fantasy game) Final Fantasy 8’s Squall and The Witcher 3’s Geralt simply cannot get enough of leaving their friends and the entire world in mortal peril while they sneak in a quick round of cards, and I love them for it. Way back when the Wild Hunt released, there was a special edition kicking about that gave you a few decks for Gwent - the fleshed-out, playable card distraction that ended up being responsible for some of the game’s best moments. I pined for those decks, but I never acquired them. Now, Hatchette Board Games is putting out a full physical edition of Gwent next year.
The set contains "over 400 cards and a playmat" for £44/$39.99. I’m still recovering from various Fantasy Flight LCGs, so my value sense for this stuff might be a bit skewed, but that strikes me as incredibly reasonable. A good Gwent deck consists of only about 25 cards. They’re not bad cards, either! I’ve got a real pet hate for tabletop versions of videogames that just use in-engine screenshots for the cards, but these ones look to have the proper artwork from the game on them:
Read more
articles.title: The Witcher 3’s Gwent is getting a full physical game next year, so you too can play cards while the world burns

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Where were you during the Summer of Doronko Wanko? Why, I remember it like it was March, and not actually Summer, when the delightful free game about a mucky pomeranian was unleashed into the world. Yep, yep. It was definitely March. Roughly translating to ‘covered in mud doggy’, the game set you the task of racking up tangible financial damage to your owner’s house by getting mud everywhere - first by normal dog means, and then with giant mud cannons. You can grab it for free on Steam here.
It stole our hearts, it did. And talking of stealing things and having a good time doing it, it’s also releasing on the Nintendo Switch soon, which means the Steam version of Doronko Wanko is getting some free DLC to celebrate. It isn’t arriving until next Spring, but it’s bringing three new mystery dog breeds with it when it does.
Read more
articles.title: Canine filth-criminal Doronko Wanko is getting some new dog breeds to cause tangible financial damage with

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
If you’d told me last year that face of all-out, GPU venerating, fully ray-traced PC game visual excess would be that of a de-aged Harrison Ford, I’d have asked which exact colour of paint you’d been eating. And yet here we are, with Indiana Jones and the Great Circle loving its ray tracing so much that the effects can’t ever be fully switched off.
Read more
articles.title: Mandatory ray tracing makes Indiana Jones and the Great Circle pretty yet brutal, like Indy himself

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Every fascist in this game has a cold. The Hitlerites and blackshirts of Indiana Jones And The Great Circle sneeze and cough as they patrol the dig sites of Gizeh, or the marble corridors of the Vatican. Although this is the Machine Games' clever way of letting you know where your enemies are at all times, it is also mildly funny, as if all the Nazis have been secretly kissing each other, spreading the same rhinovirus from Italy to Egypt to Nepal and beyond. More than that, it's a stubborn reminder that, despite the many hours of perfectly motion-captured cinematics that accompany all this, you are still playing a video game. A snotty tissue that separates the Indy of taut two-hour cinema and the Indy of a sweeping first-person punch 'em up that will take days to complete. All this is to say, you will notice the difference. But that might not matter; they're both still Indiana Jones. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Indiana Jones And The Great Circle review: a grand adventure that keeps faith with the movies

articles.author: RPS
articles.description:
Open a door, then back here again, open a door, then back here again. It's as if we're caught in some infernal loop. Thankfully we get to talk to you, our attractive friends, in the moments between. 

OK, ready to go again. Let's open the door.

 
Read more
articles.title: The RPS Advent Calendar 2024, December 6th

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
When last we left myself, on a mission to survive S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 by weaponising its monsters instead of shooting its guns, my one-with-nature experiment was yielding mixed results. At best. I’d successfully lured some bandits into the deadly lair of a bucket-tossing Poltergeist, but several attempts at more actively siccing mutated pigs on the Zone’s human baddies had all failed, even when I’d seemed to actually tame one.
Now, my only friend lay dead at my feet, and I’m in dire need of some new beasts to master. And some cash. It turns out that a fighting style that involves letting shopping trolley-sized swine creatures chew on my heels is bad for the ol’ HP, and having recently blown my savings on half a sausage, I’m forced to shift focus from my current debt collection mission towards a means to fill my own coffers.
Read more
articles.title: The Beastmaster of S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2, part two: the Zone bites back

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I think It’s safe to say that Trigger Happy Interactive’s upcoming survival horror Total Chaos is a bit of a palette change from their last offering - the frenetic, neon-drenched, chainsaw-legged Turbo Overkill. Still, it’s not often we see psychological horror combined with ultraviolence, and anything that gives off even a whiff of Condemned: Criminal Origins has my attention.
Total Chaos started life as a popular Doom 2 mod, and while I dare the say the limitations of that game sell the atmosphere a little better than this much sleeker update, I certainly trust Trigger Happy enough to make the most of the new engine. The game is set in New Oasis, a “once bustling haven for coal miners” that is now most definitely not bustling, nor haven-like.
Read more
articles.title: Total Chaos is a grimy horror FPS from the Turbo Overkill devs

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The Horsemen of the Apocalypse are War, Famine, Death and Pestilence. The Drivers of the Apocalypse are Grappling Hooks, Vehicle Swapping, Boss Battles and Upgrades. You'll get to meet all four of the latter in the video game of the same name, a combat racer from Dinosaurs Are Better (citation needed) and their publishers Bonus Stage.
 
Read more
articles.title: Drivers Of The Apocalypse combines Mad Max with the vehicle-grappling of Just Cause

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
The demimimise of Mimimi means I'm now on the lookout for my next opportunity to crouch behind a hedge, distract a man with a stone or coin, and then choke him unconscious. (And in the game.) Eriksholm: The Stolen Dream looks like a worthy candidate. Announced last year, there's now a new trailer showing the isometric (isometrish?) narrative stealth in action.

 
Read more
articles.title: Eriksholm: The Stolen Dream is a stealth 'em up that's a bit Desperados, a bit Dunwall

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Some day, somebody's going to make a cosy or wholesome submarine game, in which the submarine does not sprout leaks, does not run out of O2, and is never once invaded by any octopod-raddled zombies. That day is not today. Today there is only icy darkness and suffocation. Say "hello" and probably also "AIEEEEBLubLBBLBLBL" to Darkwater, a new co-op horror extraction game in which you brave the frigid oceans of an alien moon.

 
Read more
articles.title: In ocean co-op horror Darkwater you can ride a torpedo through an infested submarine's hull

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Nightdive, you done good. The Thing: Remastered is an ultra-sharp and commendably playable update to a game that history will remember as ‘actually a pretty good pick at Choices when you really just popped in to get some Revels but got embarrassed when the till staffer said “is that everything?” in a tone that could have been neutral but equally could have been a damning indictment of your character’.
I’m being slightly facetious here, of course. History actually remembers Computer Artworks’s 2002 shooty horror game for how incredibly ambitious and conceptually inventive its proto-sus social squad system was. In homage to the body-snatching alien paranoia of Carpenter’s 1982 horror classic, The Thing tasks you with not just assembling and directing a squad, but keeping them from breaking down or turning on you - in fear you might be hosting the titular molecular stowaway.
Read more
articles.title: The Thing: Remastered review: a fantastic remaster of a game best observed from a distance

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Dogubomb’s Blue Prince boasts my favourite shapeshifting house in a video game, which admittedly isn’t setting a very high bar. Perhaps surprisingly, most video game houses do not shapeshift. Despite being made out of pure imagination and carbon emissions, they remain nostalgically shackled to the limitations of brick, mortar and Euclidean geometry. Blue Prince’s abode is different. It is a house made of house. You’ll actually design the layout yourself every time you wander through it, picking from a selection of mismatched room types whenever you open a door.
  
Read more
articles.title: Probably-magnificent mystery house puzzler Blue Prince will release in spring 2025

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
There was a crowded second there when I read the press release and thought they’d militarised the Beano, but Menace is not, in fact, about Dennis the Menace joining the Colonial Marines. It’s the new turn-based tactics RPG from the creators of Battle Brothers, and look at that, it has a freshly deployed gameplay trailer.

 
Read more
articles.title: Here's a new trailer for Menace, the turn-based mechwar RPG from the Battle Brothers devs

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Covering announcement shows mean saving oneself for huge reveals, and since I might be the only person in the world right now this excited for FPS Mekkablood: Quarry Assault, I wondered if it might be better to hold off until a less pressing time. And then I thought, no: the people need to know. Not about the game itself, since it's been announced for a while. Simply that I, personally, cannot resist a first person mech game where you have a fast food beverage inside your cockpit. It’s an extremely niche set of parameters and I’m elated it’s finally been fulfilled. Let’s chuffing gooooooooo!
Read more
articles.title: I've changed my mind - Mekkablood: Quarry Assault is the only good videogame

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Anyone who is not trying to sell your something will tell you that ‘punk’ is a mostly meaningless term, mainly popularised by Malcolm McLaren and Vivian Westwood so they could sell bondage gear to teenagers. It is, of course, very punk of me to recognise this. However, this hasn’t stopped every other videogame released in the last 74 years trying to coin their own punk subgenre. The latest to do so is ‘brinepunk’ FPS Abyssus, which seems to have mostly arrived at the terms by being ‘a bit Steampunk, but underwater’. Abyssus looks cool, and so with the power vested in me by the Greggs vegan sausage roll I had for lunch today, I hereby declare that this is the last game allowed to do this. Let’s see if it’s making the most of it, at least.
Read more
articles.title: FPS Abyssus is allowed to call itself ‘brinepunk’ but you all need to stop this nonsense immediately afterward

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Ah, it feels just like yesterday when Citizen Sleeper 2: Starward Vector had around a year of development time left. Actually, I’d say it feels like it precisely around February 2nd of this year. Well, would you look at that. It seems making excellent RPGs isn’t Jump Over The Age’s only skill. They’ve also predicted the exact release of their game to within a 3 day margin of error: the actual release date is the 31st of January, 2025.
Read more
articles.title: Spacefaring RPG Citizen Sleeper 2: Starward Vector gets a release date: January 31st 2025

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
4X strategy and RPG stalwarts Shiro Games have announced SpaceCraft, a "massively multiplayer management and crafting adventure" set in Normandy during the Middle Ages, haha, of course not - it's set in space. They won't be winning the T.S. Eliot poetry prize with that title, but I guess it gets the job done. Here's a trailer.
  
Read more
articles.title: Northgard, Dune and Wartales devs Shiro Games reveal sci-fi MMO SpaceCraft

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Intel přidává Round Robin Strict pro Battlemage/Xe2 a nové řízení spotřeby pro Lunar Lake, Ubuntu 25.04 vyjde s jádrem Linux 6.14, vyšla vývojová verze Wine 10.0-rc2 opravující nejen Borderlands 3.
articles.title: KDE vylepšuje škálování UI, Intel podporu Lunar Lake a Battlemage

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: První karty druhé generace Intelu zamířily na trh a s nimi se objevily i první testy. Nevypadá špatně, což konstatují i někteří testeři, jenž strávili poslední roky kritizováním Intelu, často oprávněným.
articles.title: Intel Arc B580: slušná grafická karta s dobrým linuxovým potenciálem

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Bařina)
articles.description: Collatzova domněnka, fascinující matematický problém, zůstává nevyřešená. V roce 2020 byla ale výpočetně ověřena pro všechna čísla až do velikosti 2⁶⁸. Ukážeme si, jak toho bylo dosaženo.
articles.title: Výpočetní ověření Collatzovy domněnky až do velikosti 2⁶⁸

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Se serializačním formátem nazvaným MessagePack jsme se již na stránkách Roota jednou setkali. Dnes si ukážeme, jak se tento formát používá v jazyku Python, a to včetně serializace N-dimenzionálních polí knihovny NumPy.
articles.title: Využití serializačního formátu MessagePack v Pythonu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Michal Hrušecký)
articles.description: Projekt OpenWrt nedávno oznámil přechod ze stávajícího formátu balíčků opkg na apk. Co to znamená pro běžného uživatele? Jak se tyto dva formáty a nástroje s nimi pracující vlastně liší?
articles.title: OpenWrt přechází z opkg na balíčky apk – jaký je v tom vlastně rozdíl?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: Pravidelná středeční sonda do světa software. Dnes se společně podíváme na nástroj pro správu ACME certifikátů, vytvoříme animaci pro web a nakonec si budeme řídit zabezpečení síťového provozu.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (11. 12. 2024): rychlé mazání souborů ve více vláknech

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Billu Gatesovi se připisuje výrok „640K ought to be enough for anybody“, který ovšem pravděpodobně nikdy neřekl. Na počítačích IBM PC se skutečně dlouhou dobu bojovalo s omezenými možnostmi adresování většího paměťového rozsahu.
articles.title: 640K by mělo stačit každému: skutečně?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Bařina)
articles.description: Dnes se podíváme, jak fungují bezeztrátové nebo téměř bezeztrátové formáty obrazu. K tomu bude ale nejprve třeba seznámit se s tím, co to jsou prediktory. Poté si podrobně rozebereme formáty GIF, PNG a JPEG-LS.
articles.title: Bezeztrátové formáty obrazu: GIF, PNG a JPEG-LS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Přijďte k nám na odborná školení pořádaná serverem Root.cz. Přijďte se vzdělávat a rozvíjet své dovednosti. Můžete získat dotaci až 82%, ať jste zaměstnanec, podnikatel, nezaměstnaný nebo třeba student.
articles.title: Neplaťte si IT kurzy sami, využijte dotace od EU, ať jste zaměstnanec nebo podnikatel

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: CSIRT.CZ)
articles.description: V dnešním dílu bezpečnostních postřehů se podíváme na nebezpečnou zranitelnost v Google Chrome, na varování FBI před AI, zneužívání MMS zpráv nebo novou taktiku útočníků určenou k oklamání antivirů.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: zranitelnost v Google Chrome umožňuje vzdálené spuštění kódu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Google oznámil kvantovou nadvládu již před pěti lety se svým čipem Sycamore s 53 qubity. Nyní přichází další supravodivý čip Willow (vrba) se 105 qubity a lepší opravou kvantových chyb. S jeho pomocí bylo vyřešena jedna úloha za méně než pět minut. Ta stejná úloha by největšímu superpočítači trvala 1025 let, což o mnoho řádů překračuje předpokládané stáří vesmíru 1,4×1010 let.
articles.title: Google vylepšuje kvantovou nadvládu čipem Willow se 105 qubity

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V žebříčku oblíbenosti linuxových distribucí na serveru DistroWatch došlo ke změně na prvním a druhém místě. Nyní je první Linux Mint a druhý je MX Linux. Obě distribuce se soustředí na začátečníky.
articles.title: Nejoblíbenější distribucí je podle DistroWatch Linux Mint před MX Linux

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nedávno Linus Torvalds odmítl do jádra úrovně architektury x86_64, ale překlad s přepínačem -march=native již nevadí. Tento přepínač způsobí, že se automaticky použijí vlastnosti procesoru, na kterém kompilace běží.
articles.title: Jádro bude mít -march=native

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: johny)
articles.description: Minulý týždeň Meta vydala novú verziu svojho vlajkového jazykového modelu Llama 3.3. Nová Llama 3.3 70B ponúka výkon porovnateľný s väčším modelom Llama 3.1 405B. Nový model je výrazne menší, rýchlejší a lacnejší. Model je optimalizovaný pre nákladovú efektívnosť, čo ho robí prístupnejším pre vývojárov a výskumníkov. Ak máme veriť oficiálnym údajom, Llama 3.3 70B model je 25-krát lacnejší ako jeho konkurent GPT-4o mini. Llama 3.3 v súčasnosti podporuje len textový mód. Jazykový model Llama 3.3 70B je možné si vyskúšať na high-endových notebookoch a desktopoch.
articles.title: Vyšli nové jazykové modely Llama 3.3 a Gemini 2.0.

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Firefox podporoval Do Not Track (DNT) již 13 let. Bohužel webové stránky na signál DNT nereagují, naopak jej používají s ostatními nastaveními a rozšířeními k identifikaci uživatele (fingerprinting). Z tohoto důvodu Apple odstranil DNT ze Safari již v roce 2019. V Chrome a jeho forcích zatím DNT zůstává.
articles.title: Do Not Track končí ve Firefoxu 135

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojáři uvolnili CentOS Stream 10 s kódovým jménem Coughlan. CentOS Stream 10 vytváří upstream pro Red Hat Enterprise Linuxu 10, ze kterého jsou vytvářeny minoritní verze RHEL 10. Představuje tedy náhled toho, co se chystá pro budoucí verze RHEL 10. Tato verze by měla být udržována přibližně do roku 2030.
articles.title: CentOS Stream 10 vychází s jádrem 6.12, zato bez X.Org a dalších balíčků

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Poptávka po IT odbornících v oblasti kvality a testování softwaru roste. Vývojáři se snaží psát kód tak, aby fungoval správně, ale mohou přehlédnout některé chyby. Taková chyba ale může způsobit velké problémy. Tester je proto nepostradatelnou součástí vývojového procesu a je zásadním prvkem vývoje softwaru. Dívá se na software z pohledu uživatele a pomáhá vše ladit k dokonalosti.
articles.title: Testing Akademie: naučte se testovat kvalitu softwaru v online kurzu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Na serveru GOG.com začaly zimní slevy. U té příležitosti je možné získat zdarma hru The Whispered World: Special Edition. Jde o klikací adventuru od Daedalic Entertainment. Ve fantasy hře jste Sandwick, který ve snech vidí modrou kouli a konec světa. Ve hře se konci světa snaží zabránit.
articles.title: Hra zdarma na GOG.com The Whispered World

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: PeoplePath)
articles.description: Společnost PeoplePath pořádá v Plzni workshopy na různá IT témata. Tentokrát bylo téma „The One Billion Row Challenge: je PHP rychlejší než Java?“ a byl pořízen videozáznam.
articles.title: Video z workshopu The One Billion Row Challenge: je PHP rychlejší než Java?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: anonymní)
articles.description: Ve čtvrtek 19. prosince se uskuteční OWASP Czech chapter meeting, který po delší době zavítá do Prahy. Registrovaným jako vždy nabídne přísun zajímavostí z oblasti IT bezpečnosti a to ve formě tří večerních přednášek, na které je registrace zcela zdarma. Detaily programu a možnost se registrovat naleznete na Eventbrite.
articles.title: Pozvánka na OWASP Czech chapter meeting 19. prosince v Praze

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: V dubnu letošního roku oznámila společnost SiFive vývojářskou desku HiFive Premier P550 používající procesor s architekturou RISC-V. V dodávkách nové desky P550 došlo ke zpoždění, ale firma prý už s výrobou pokročila a nyní je připravena dodávat předinstalované Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. SiFive spolupracuje se společností Canonical a výrobce tak slibuje dobrou podporu.
articles.title: HiFive Premier P550 s RISC-V snižuje cenu a nabídne Ubuntu 24.04 LTS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Josh Aas, výkonný ředitel organizace Internet Security Research Group, která stojí za projektem Let’s Encrypt zveřejnil výroční veřejný dopis, ve kterém informoval o aktuálním stavu certifikační autority a výhledu do nejbližší budoucnosti.
articles.title: Let’s Encrypt příští rok nabídne certifikáty se šestidenní platností

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Zdeněk Brůna, technický ředitel sdružení CZ.NIC, zveřejnil statistiky aukcí domén za prvních šest měsíců jejich provozu. Do aukce se dostanou zrušené nebo zaniklé domény, které se nově neuvolňují k další registraci, ale putují do dražby. Více v článku CZ.NIC spouští aukce domén, běží veřejné testování.
articles.title: Za půl roku bylo vydraženo 2 803 domén v .CZ, zájem je jen o každou třicátou nabízenou

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Elektronyk)
articles.description: Vývojáři uvolnili AlmaLinux 10 Beta. Zatímco AlmaLinux OS Kitten 10 pokračuje ve následování CentOS Stream 10, tak AlmaLinux 10 beta následuje Red Hat Enterprise Linux 10 b	eta vydaný před pár dny.
articles.title: Vyšel AlmaLinux 10 beta založený na RHEL 10 beta

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: V září jsme o novém emulátoru terminálu Ptyxis GNOME vývojáře Christiana Hergerta psali v Softwarové sklizni. Na konci října vydaná Fedora 41 už jej používá jako výchozí a ke stejnému kroku se podle všeho blíží Ubuntu, minimálně jej zvažuje.
articles.title: Ptyxis možná bude výchozím terminálem i v Ubuntu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Předvánoční verze OpenMandrivy je zde a s ní i plný přechod této distribuce na Qt6 prostředí. Vedle Plasmy 5, aktuálního GNOME či COSMIC 1.0 alpha nabízí verze 24.12 hlavně čtyřkombinaci KDE Plasma 6.2.4 + KDE Applications 24.08.3 + KDE Frameworks 6.8.0 + Qt 6.8.0, případně pro méně zmlsané zájemce o Qt6 také novou verzi desktopu LXQt, již na bázi této verze Qt.
articles.title: OpenMandriva ROME 24.12 nabízí jádro 6.12, KDE Plasma 6 či Chromium včetně JPEG XL a GIMP 3.0

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Zajímá vás moderní přístup ke službám a témata jako Docker, kontejnery, cloud, virtualizace a Kubernetes? Připravili jsme pro vás čtyřdenní kurz Docker s Kubernetes, na který můžete získat dotaci až 82 % od Úřadu práce. Kontaktujte naši kolegyni pavla.hettnerova@iinfo.cz. K dotaci se musíte přihlásit do 19. prosince.
articles.title: Čtyřdenní kurz Docker s Kubernetes dotovaný Úřadem práce

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Už i otevřený firmware pro základní desku MSI PRO Z790-P WIFI přináší v nové verzi opravu řešící nestabilitu běhu posledních generací CPU Intel Raptor Lake. Nechybí podpora provádění aktualizací a migrace nastavení či aktualizace mikrokódu CPU rodin Alder Lake i Raptor Lake (aktuálně používá verzi 0×12B), dále podpora dual TPM či nové konfigurační menu pro CPU.
articles.title: Nový firmware Dasharo pro MSI PRO Z790-P a PRO Z690-A řeší nejen stabilitu CPU Raptor Lake

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Počet jader moderních CPU stále roste a s ním musí i příslušné limity. Zatímco s AMD EPYC se zásadní problémy nedějí – i přes současné 96jádrové a budoucí 128jádrové procesory nepředstavoval při počtu možných CPU socketů stávající limit 2048 jader žádný problém, u Intelu je to jiné. V rámci platformy Xeonů Granite Rapids lze stavět až 32socketové systémy, což u 128jádrového / 256vláknového Xeonu 6980P už zvýšení limitu vyžaduje.
articles.title: Linuxový subsystém perf zvedá limit na 4096 CPU jader

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Nový zákon o kybernetické bezpečnosti, Aktivity ČTÚ v roce 2025, Timeseries Troubles: Jak (ne)počítat statistiky nebo Inovace praktické výuky – Virtuální laboratoře NetLAB FEL ČVUT – to jsou jen některé z názvů přednášek, na které se mohou těšit účastníci osmého komunitního setkání nejen českých a slovenských správců sítí CSNOG 2025 (21. a 22. ledna 2025, Zlín).
articles.title: Komunitní setkání CSNOG 2025 má program a otevřené registrace

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Vilém Sládek)
articles.description: Tým projektu BIRD vydává novou stabilní verzi 2.16, ve které přibyla výrazná optimalizace BMP (BGP Monitoring Protocol) a několik vylepšení CLI. BIRD nyní také umí validovat BGP AS Path podle RPKI ASPA záznamů (jak ROA ověřuje zdroj, tak ASPA ověřuje cestu).
articles.title: BIRD 2.16 optimalizuje BMP a vylepšuje CLI

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Dalším kouskem hardwaru. jemuž se dostává podpory v rámci ovladače asus-ec-sensors, je Asus TUF GAMING X670E PLUS. Této vyšší model pro platformu AMD AM5 (aktuálně stále v prodeji kolem 7 až 8 tisíc Kč) tak v linuxovém jádru získává podporu čtení informací ze senzorů desky.
articles.title: Asus TUF GAMING X670E PLUS, další AM5 deska s podporou senzorů v jádru Linux 6.14

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Tomáš Heřmánek)
articles.description: Nová verze monitorovacího nástroje Zabbix 7.2 byla právě vydána. Tato verze přináší mnoho zajímavých novinek a vylepšení, která rozšiřují možnosti monitorování a zjednodušují správu IT prostředí. Mezi hlavní novinky patří:
articles.title: Zabbix 7.2: nová verze a pozvánka na tematické webináře

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: GNU Shepherd (původně GNU dmd) je správce služeb pro systémové i uživatelské služby, který používá Guix a který se opírá o Guile Scheme. Vývojáři nyní po 21 letech vývoje vydali verzi 1.0 a mělo by jít o řešení pro uživatele, kteří nejsou například spokojeni s initem z projektu systemd.
articles.title: Správce služeb GNU Shepherd 1.0 vydán jako alternativa k systemd

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Recall, několikrát odvolaný AI pomocník ve Windows 11, který zaznamenává vše, co uživatel ve Windows dělá, vyšel v preview verzi pro Qualcomm Snapdragon před dvěma týdny.
articles.title: Kontroverzní Recall ve Windows 11 již také pro AMD a Intel Copilot+PC

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nová metoda nabízí efektivnější vyhledávání dat z dlouhodobých datových úložišť na bázi syntetických polymerů. Bezpečnostní trendy pro rok 2025: zločinecké kouřové clony a demokratizace kyberútoků. Efektivní ukládání dat pomocí technologie ePMR. Fortinet pokračuje v rozšiřování generativní umělé inteligence napříč svým portfoliem. Jak naučit modely umělé inteligence efektivně spolupracovat.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Jak naučit modely umělé inteligence efektivně spolupracovat

articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.

articles.description: V Evropě vzniknou „továrny“ na umělou inteligenci, Česko bude jejich součástí. Důkazy o primordiálních černých dírách se mohou skrývat v planetkách, nebo dokonce v běžných objektech na Zemi.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Protonové baterie mohou mít proti lithiu řadu výhod

articles.description: Přehled listopadových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za listopad 2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: HP Wolf Security nabízí ochranu firemních počítačů před fyzickými kybernetickými útoky. ČSÚ: Tržby v ICT sektoru loni přesáhly bilion Kč. Cloudový trh nejen roste, ale tempo se navíc ještě zrychluje. Nasazení AI vyžaduje týmové úsilí. Jak řešit nedostatek dovedností v kyberbezpečnosti v malých a středně velkých podnicích.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Podle ČSÚ tržby v ICT sektoru loni přesáhly bilion Kč

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 49/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Vesmír v krabici: Slabiny simulační hypotézy. Lingvisté z Olomouce personalizují jazyk umělé inteligence. Jak se vyznat v algoritmech pro kvantové počítače? Sledovali tanec elektronů v záři explodujících neutronových hvězd.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Bez člověka u počítače kvalitní AI nevybudujete, říká regionální šéf Dell Technologies. Agenti AI a lidé budou společně pracovat na úspěchu u zákazníků. GFI Software: Firmy chybně identifikují svá kritická IT aktiva. Nový Red Hat Device Edge snižuje latenci a zefektivňuje úlohy AI na okraji sítě. Portworx umožní zrychlení úloh v systému Kubernetes. Fortinet posiluje umělou inteligenci u ochrany dat a řízení vnitřních rizik.

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Jsme u výprodeje na Black Friday. Ceny u Goodoffer24 jsou opravdu skvělé, když se podíváte na standardní koupi jejich doživotních licencí. Během výprodeje na Black Friday je cena výrazně snížena jak pro Windows, tak pro Office, zejména u klíče na  Windows 11, což je dnes nejoblíbenější produkt.
articles.title: Jen jednou za rok můžete na Black Friday získat u Goodoffer24 doživotní licenci na Windows 11 za €20 a Office za €24!

articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Čipové války

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Rakudo (Wikipedie), tj. překladač programovacího jazyka Raku (Wikipedie), byl vydán ve verzi #178 (2024.12). Programovací jazyk Raku byl dříve znám pod názvem Perl 6.

articles.author: Fluttershy, yay!
articles.description: Desktopové prostředí Xfce 4.20 bylo vydáno. Přináší experimentální podporu Waylandu. Podrobnosti v seznamu změn.
articles.title: Xfce 4.20

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Organizace Apache Software Foundation (ASF) vydala verzi 24 integrovaného vývojového prostředí a vývojové platformy napsané v Javě NetBeans (Wikipedie). Přehled novinek na GitHubu. Instalovat lze také ze Snapcraftu a Flathubu.

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Na GOG.COM probíhá Winter Sale 2024. Při té příležitosti lze každý den do konce roku najít v kalendář uprostřed stránky Winter Sale 2024 nějaké překvapení. Otevření balíčku s překvapením vždy ve tři odpoledne. Prvním překvapením byla hra The Whispered World: Special Edition zdarma.
articles.title: Na GOG.COM do konce roku každý den překvapení

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Google ve spolupráci se společnostmi Samsung a Qualcomm představil (YouTube) platformu pro rozšířenou realitu Android XR. První zařízení s Androidem XR budou k dispozici v roce 2025.
articles.title: Android XR

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byl představen CentOS Stream 10 s kódovým názvem Coughlan. Detaily v poznámkách k vydání. CentOS Stream 10 už neobsahuje balíček s Xorg serverem (xorg-x11-server-Xorg). O zobrazování se stará Wayland s Xwaylandem (xorg-x11-server-Xwayland). Odstraněny byly aplikace Firefox, GIMP, LibreOffice, Inkscape a Thunderbird. Ty jsou k dispozici ve Flatpaku z Flathubu.

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byly vyhlášeny výsledky The Game Awards 2024 (YouTube). Hrou roku se stal Astro Bot (YouTube) běžící pouze na PlayStation 5.

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Nezisková organizace Internet Security Research Group (ISRG) vydala Výroční zprávu za rok 2024 (pdf). Organizace stojí za certifikační autoritou Let's Encrypt, projektem Prossimo, jehož cílem je používání paměťově bezpečného kódu v kritické internetové infrastruktuře a službou Divvi Up řešící telemetrii respektující soukromí uživatelů.
articles.title: Výroční zpráva Internet Security Research Group (ISRG) za rok 2024

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Vývojáři PeerTube, tj. svobodné alternativy k videoplatformám velkých technologických společností, představili mobilní aplikaci PeerTube (Google Play, App Store). Zdrojové kódy jsou k dispozici na Framagitu.
articles.title: Mobilní aplikace PeerTube

articles.description: Google představil Gemini 2.0, tj. novou verzi svého modelu umělé inteligence (YouTube).

articles.description: After roughly two years of development the Xfce 4.20 lightweight desktop has been released ahead of the year end holidays...
articles.title: Xfce 4.20 Desktop Released With Wayland Improvements & New Features

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: It's been a while since there has been anything new to report on the Btrfs file-system's built-in RAID functionality but that is changing with RAID1 round-robin read balancing...
articles.title: Btrfs Working On RAID1 Round-Robin Read Balancing

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: In addition to Linux 6.14 set to add sensor monitoring support for the ASUS TUF GAMING X670E PLUS, another lower-cost AMD AM5 motherboard is also set to see sensor monitoring support with this next version of the Linux kernel...
articles.title: Linux 6.14 To Add Sensor Monitoring For A ~$180 ASRock AM5 Motherboard

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Linux 6.6.66 was released today alongside other updated Long Term Support (LTS) kernel versions...
articles.title: Linux 6.6.66 LTS Kernel Released With New Hardware Support & Many Fixes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Some Qualcomm processors/SoCs on the mainline Linux kernel are left vulnerable to Spectre security issues since Qualcomm hasn't upstreamed patches for properly treating affected CPU cores to their relevant mitigations. But a new patch series  from a Google engineer is working to get those Qualcomm CPU security mitigations in order...
articles.title: Some Qualcomm CPUs Left Exposed To Spectre Vulnerabilities On Mainline Linux

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: As covered last month on Phoronix, Intel has been experimenting with Energy Aware Scheduling (EAS) for the Intel P-State driver with a goal of enhancing the power efficiency of Core Ultra "Lunar Lake" processors. Recently a second iteration of that work was posted for review ahead of possible inclusion in a future version of the Linux kernel...
articles.title: Intel P-State Energy Aware Scheduling Patches Updated For Lunar Lake

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: An interesting addition to Mesa 25.0 this week is Alyssa Rosenzweig adding a standard library for the driver OpenCL C code, including the initial abbility to support assert() on device and other standard C constructs for the OpenCL C code...
articles.title: Mesa 25.0 Introduces Standard Library For Driver OpenCL C

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: After some six months of silence, this past week the NTSYNC LInux kernel driver patches were revived for completing this open-source driver to better match the Windows NT synchronization primitives to help with Wine / Proton (Steam Play) Windows gaming performance on Linux. Following those "v6" patches posted a few days ago, on Friday evening a seventh iteration of the patches were volleyed to offer up some API design improvements for this NTSYNC driver...
articles.title: NTSYNC Linux Driver Updated With API Design Improvements

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While not as popular as their Snapdragon SoCs, Qualcomm has been offering their Cloud AI line of accelerators for scalable AI inference. The current flagship is the Qualcomm Cloud AI 100 Ultra as a 150 Watt rated PCIe Gen4 x16 card for up to 870 TOPS INT8 performance, 576MB of SRAM, and 128GB LPR4x memory. But given the latest open-source Linux driver patch activity, Cloud AI 200 "AIC200" wares are on the way...
articles.title: Qualcomm Preps Cloud AI 200 "AIC200" Accelerator Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: KDE developers continue to be quite busy ahead of the holidays to pack more features into the upcoming Plasma 6.3 desktop release...
articles.title: KDE Plasma 6.3 Delivers Much Better Fractional Scaling, Clipboard Using SQLite

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Building off last week's release of Wine 10.0-rc1 is now Wine 10.0-rc2 as the next test release in working toward the Wine 10.0 stable debut around mid January...
articles.title: Wine 10.0-rc2 Released With 21 Fixes For The Week

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel's open-source Linux graphics driver engineers are busy working to further refine the Xe2 graphics performance for Lunar Lake integrated graphics and the newly-launched Battlemage discrete graphics. Landing in Mesa 25.0-devel this Friday afternoon is a new "Round Robin Strict" optimization to benefit both their OpenGL and Vulkan drivers on Linux with Xe2 hardware...
articles.title: Intel Lands "Round Robin Strict" Driver Optimization For Helping Battlemage/Xe2

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Following the OpenZFS 2.2.7 stable point release earlier this week that brought Linux 6.12 LTS kernel compatibility along with various fixes, OpenZFS 2.3-rc4 is out today as the latest step toward the big OpenZFS 2.3 feature release...
articles.title: OpenZFS 2.3-rc4 Released With Linux 6.12 LTS Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The COBOL programming language may be 65 years old since its original release but the mainline GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) in 2025 might finally see upstream support for it...
articles.title: Patches Posted For Review Adding COBOL Frontend To GCC Compiler

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Yesterday I shared the Linux gaming performance and OpenCL / GPU compute performance for the new Intel Arc B580 Battlemage graphics card. Today the focus is a look at how well the Linux workstation graphics performance for Battlemage is looking relative to the existing Alchemist hardware with the Intel Arc A-Series graphics cards.
articles.title: Intel Arc B580 Battlemage Linux Workstation Graphics Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Hans-Kristian Arntzen  with Valve just released VKD3D-Proton 2.14 as the newest version of this Direct3D 12 implementation built atop the Vulkan API for Valve's Steam Play (Proton)...
articles.title: VKD3D-Proton 2.14 Released With New Features For D3D12 On Vulkan

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: This shouldn't be too surprising especially after Canonical's commitment last year to always ship the latest upstream kernel version for Ubuntu releases moving forward, but the plan was confirmed today that Ubuntu 25.04 intends to ship with the Linux 6.14 kernel...

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The SPIR-V target within the LLVM compiler for outputting to this common IR used across different accelerator/device types, different APIs from Vulkan and SYCL to GLSL / OpenCL / HLSL, and adapted for a variety of innovative use-cases could soon become an official target within LLVM...
articles.title: Intel Looking To Raise SPIR-V Backend To Becoming An Official LLVM Target

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Merged this week to GNOME's Mutter compositor for the GNOME 48 release is support for the wp_viewport protocol for cursor surfaces in order to provide a nicer experience on cursor scaling...
articles.title: GNOME 48 Mutter To Enjoy Improved Cursor Scaling For Wine Wayland & More

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel engineer and Linux power management subsystem maintainer Rafael Wysocki queued up several power management related patches this week for Intel's upcoming Core Ultra "Panther Lake" processors as well as the next-gen Xeon Clearwater Forest processors...
articles.title: Intel Panther Lake & Clearwater Forest Power Management Patches For Linux 6.14

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Following the recent Red Hat Enterprise Linux 10 Beta, CentOS Stream 10 has now reached general availability status. CentOS Stream 10 defines the upstream Red Hat Enterprise Linux 10 that the RHEL 10 minor versions are created from and ultimately a preview of what's coming down the pipe for future RHEL 10 releases. CentOS Stream 10 had been available in a preview phase since earlier this year while now is considered GA...
articles.title: CentOS Stream 10 Reaches GA With Linux 6.12, Python 3.12 & No X.Org Server

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While Fedora Workstation has defaulted to using the Btrfs file-system for the past four years, only this past summer was the idea raised of creating a Fedora special interest group (SIG) around Btrfs to help advance efforts around this CoW file-system for Fedora Linux integration. This week marks the Fedora Btrfs SIG officially being established...
articles.title: Btrfs SIG Established For Advancing Btrfs Interests On Fedora

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Building off last month's release of the LibreOffice 25.2 Alpha release for this free software office suite, out today is the first beta release of the upcoming LibreOffice 25.2...
articles.title: LibreOffice 25.2 Beta 1 Office Suite Ready For Testing

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A new "Fedora COSMIC" spin of Fedora Linux has been proposed that would feature the Rust-based COSMIC desktop environment currently being developed by Linux PC vendor System76...
articles.title: Fedora COSMIC Desktop Spin Proposed For Fedora 42

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last week Intel announced the Arc B-Series Battlemage graphics cards as their first Xe2 discrete GPUs. Ahead of the Arc B580 graphics card hitting Internet retailers tomorrow, today the review embargo lifts on the Intel Arc B580. Here is what to expect from the Linux driver support at launch for the Intel Battlemage graphics cards and how the Arc B580 is performing for Linux gaming/graphics workloads.
articles.title: Intel Arc B580 Graphics Open-Source Driver Linux Gaming Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Now that the initial Intel Arc B580 graphics card gaming review on Linux is out, for productivity-minded users you may be more curious about the GPU compute potential... Here are some initial OpenCL and Level Zero results for the Intel Arc B580 graphics card compared to the Intel Arc A-Series and the AMD Radeon and NVIDIA GeForce competition under Linux.
articles.title: Intel Arc B580 Delivers Promising Linux GPU Compute Potential For Battlemage

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Earlier this month as part of patches for cleaning up x86 32-bit kernel code for x86_64 systems, there was a patch to drop support for 32-bit x86 KVM host support. That patch has now been split off into its own patch series with also now raising the prospects of ending 32-bit KVM host support across all CPU architectures rather than being just an x86-only change...
articles.title: Linux Developers Consider Ending 32-bit KVM Host Virtualization Support`

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While the Linux 6.13 merge window only recently ended and that kernel won't be out until around the end of January followed by the start of the Linux 6.14 merge window, Intel software engineers on Wednesday sent out their first two pull requests to DRM-Next of new kernel graphics driver features they are readying for this next version of the Linux kernel...
articles.title: Intel Begins Readying Graphics Driver Changes For The Linux 6.14 Kernel

articles.author: Michael Larabel

articles.title: AMD GFX 11.5.3 Graphics Support Added To Mesa 25.0

articles.title: KDE Gear 24.12 Released With Many Improvements To KDE Apps

articles.description: The PanVK open-source Vulkan API driver for Arm Mali graphics hardware within Mesa is now advertising Vulkan 1.1 support rather than Vulkan 1.0. But it's known to be "broken" so don't be too excited about it yet...
articles.title: PanVK Advertises "Broken" Vulkan 1.1 Support With Mesa 25.0-devel

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
Marvel Rivals has launched with a host of popular names from the superhero universe, but some of them are better than the rest.


In the first couple of days, it has become quite clear that a few characters are a notch above the rest. In their respective roles, they're the best options to consider. That said, the names present on the lower tiers also have their uses. In the right hands, they can be quite powerful.


Update Changelog


December 12, 2024: Jeff has been moved to S-tier. Wolverine has been dropped to B-tier.

Marvel Rivals S-tier list

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
If you've logged into Fisch after the launch of the Fischmas update, chances are that you've already found a mysterious Snow Globe in your inventory.


In case you still haven't figured it out, the Snow Globe is part of the latest content update and the key to a brand-new location. The Winter Village is the latest region to have been added as part of the Fischmas event, and you'll need the globe to reach the position. There are plenty of great reasons why you should travel to the new map, so let's take a look at how you can travel there in the first place.


What is the Snow Globe in Fisch


If you've updated your game, you should be able to find the Winter Village on your map. Unlike a few other regions, you won't need to do anything hard. The Snow Globe in your inventory will allow you to teleport you to the new region, making it ideal for beginners and veterans alike.


Like all additions to the Fischmas event, this item will be available for a limited time only, so make sure to use it while it's present in your inventory.




How to use the Snow Globe to reach Winter Village in Fisch


Here's how you can use the item to reach Winter Village.



Open the game and let it load.


Open your inventory, and you will be able to find the Snow Globe.


From your inventory, move the item to your hotbar.


Select the item from your Hotbar to activate it, and you'll be taken directly to the Winter Village.



The Winter Village has plenty of content waiting for you, including its own limited Bestiary with 15 new items. The new region also has fresh rods that you can find all across the region to expand your inventory. The new fish types also have limited and permanent mutations that allow you to get more credits.


If you're looking for even more ways to customize your in-game experience, there are three different skin crates that are now available to be opened with in-game credits.

The post How to find the Winter Village Island and use the Snow Globe in Fisch appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to find the Winter Village Island and use the Snow Globe in Fisch

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
The 12 Days of Giving event has begun in NBA 2K25, and you can get a few amazing rewards over the next couple of weeks to help your MyTeam and MyCareer progression.


This is a yearly tradition from 2K, who offer plenty of freebies ahead of the Christmas period. All the items are naturally available for free, and getting them is pretty easy. The only concern is to get the rewards before they expire, as the 12 Days of Giving event will be a time-limited campaign. Let's take a look at the first offering, which is now available for you to obtain.


How to get the 12 Days of Giving items in NBA 2K25


It seems that 2K is following the same tradition this year, and all the offerings will be in the form of codes. If you've redeemed codes in the past, you'll be well aware of how to do it. If you haven't here are the steps, and it's pretty simple. Before we begin, make sure that you're logged into your 2K account inside the game.



Open your game and let it load.


Go to the MyTeam option.


Select the Market tab on the top of your screen.


Select the Locker Codes option, and a text box will open.


Enter the code from the list mentioned here.


Confirm to get all your rewards.



After redeeming the code, the rewards will be sent to your in-game store in the form of packs.




All NBA 2K25 12 Days of Giving code


As of writing, we have only one code that has been presented by 2K. All the codes that will be released over the next few days will be updated and added to this list.



12DAYS-GOTG-OPTION-PACK: You'll get a Gems of the Game Option pack with five items. All five items will be of Amethyst rarity, and you can choose the one you like the most.



It will be interesting to find out what 2K hands us next. Last year, there were some cool Christmas-themed cosmetics, and that might be the case once again this year.

The post NBA 2K25 12 Days of Giving: How to get all free items appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: NBA 2K25 12 Days of Giving: How to get all free items

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
There are some subtle differences between the crafting system of Path of Exile 2 and that of the first game, and anointing an item has undergone a noticeable change.


If you've spent a fair few hours in the early access, you must have noticed that there are lots of currency types, and all of them have their key functions. Distilled Emotions are a completely new type, at least to my knowledge, and they can be used to anoint amulets to make them more powerful with the help of passive skills.


Path of Exile 2 Anoint mechanism explained


Distilled Emotions might be new, but the process of anointing an amulet isn't new. It's present in Path of Exile, but the currency has undergone a change. In the older title, you can anoint an amulet with the help of oils.


First, go to your skill tree and decide on the passive skill. Doing so will tell you the exact Distilled Emotions that you will need for the skill. At launch, there are 10 available options to pick from. Once you know the required Distilled Emotions, right-click on it to open the Instilling Window. Once done, you'll be able to place the skill in your amulet.




Do note that the placement order will matter when installing Distilled Emotions. Here are all the available options that are currently in the early access.



Distilled Despair


Distilled Disgust


Distilled Envy


Distilled Fear


Distilled Greed


Distilled Ire


Distilled Suffering


Distilled Paranoia


Distilled Isolation


Distilled Guilt



As GGG adds new content, new Distilled Emotions are likely going to be added as well, which will help you to have anoints with new skills. The core process will remain the same.

The post How to anoint in Path of Exile 2 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to anoint in Path of Exile 2
